summary: This is a U.S. Attorney's Office press release announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell on charges of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, and for perjury. It details the allegations against her, including her role in grooming and facilitating abuse from 1994 to 1997, and notes her arrest in New Hampshire.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with enticing minors to travel for illegal sex acts, conspiracy, and perjury for her alleged role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as Maxwell's co-conspirator in a scheme to sexually abuse minor girls, with a stated preference for young girls. Deceased at the time of this release.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release and made a statement condemning Maxwell's alleged crimes and her role in delivering victims to Epstein.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Made a statement praising the victims' bravery and condemning Maxwell and Epstein for disregarding the law and harming vulnerable youth.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement commending investigators and partners for their commitment to bringing justice to survivors of sexual assault.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom Maxwell's case is assigned.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together from at least 1994 to 1997 to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated, aided, and participated in Epstein's sexual abuse of minors, and in some cases participated in the abuse herself.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in the morning and charged in a Manhattan federal court indictment. She was expected to be presented in federal court in New Hampshire in the afternoon.

events.title: Period of Alleged Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein exploited girls as young as 14, enticing them to travel for illegal sex acts during this period.

events.title: Maxwell's Deposition and Perjury
events.description: Maxwell is charged with perjury for making several false statements under oath during a civil proceeding deposition.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged with conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, transporting a minor for criminal sexual activity, and perjury.
The indictment alleges Maxwell played a critical role in grooming and abusing minor victims for Jeffrey Epstein from at least 1994 to 1997.
Victims were as young as 14 years old and abuse occurred at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, and at Maxwell's London residence.
Maxwell is charged with perjury for false statements made under oath during a 2016 civil deposition.
The case is being prosecuted by the U.S. Attorney's Public Corruption Unit and assigned to U.S. District Judge Alison J. Nathan.
